Dear Mr. Gonzalez,
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards & Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/26/23, there was an altercation between a staff member and
youth in which the staff member initiated physical contact with a
youth. Youth retaliated with physical contact and staff member
choked youth. Youth sustained scratches to the right side of the
neck.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Supervisor was interviewed via phone on
1/26/23 and in person at the facility on 1/27/23 in conjunction
with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor reported she was off-site when
the incident occurred. When she returned to the home, she
reviewed the video and saw Staff 1 put his hands on Youth A in an
inappropriate way. Supervisor reported the video showed multiple
times when Staff 1 could have left, but he didn’t. Supervisor
reported Staff 1 used to be a youth in the home and worked as a
youth specialist in a Supervised Independent Living Placement
prior to becoming the House Parent for Casa Del Sol in June
2022. Supervisor reported Staff 1 gets along with the youth and
other staff very well and there have been no incidents involving
him previously. Supervisor reported the incident is not reflective of
Staff 1’s or Youth A's typical behavior. Supervisor reported Staff 1
was suspended pending investigation.
Youth A was interviewed in person at the facility on 1/27/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported Youth B
came home from school sick yesterday, so Youth A went into
Youth B’s room to check on him and see if he was okay. Youth A
reported Staff 1 told him to leave the room, so he did. Youth A
2

reported he became mad because Staff 1 grabbed Youth A’s neck
when Staff 1 and Youth B were leaving the home. He reported he
doesn’t like when people touch him, so Staff 1’s actions triggered
him. Youth A reported he told Staff 1, “why don’t you come back
and do that again?”. Youth A stated Staff 1 came back inside the
house and was walking towards him, so Youth A grabbed Staff 1.
Youth A stated Staff 1 pulled him, pushed him, and choked him by
grabbing Youth A’s neck with his hand and pushing him against
the wall. Youth A stated Staff 1 squeezed Youth A’s neck when he
was holding him against the wall. He reported during the
altercation, Staff 2 came in and kept telling Staff 1 to let Youth A
go. Youth A reported Staff 1 told Youth A he could not hit anyone
in the house, including staff. Youth A reported Staff 2 pulled Staff
1 off Youth A, but Staff 1 kept coming back. Staff 2 separated
them and then Staff 1 left with Youth B. Youth A reported Staff 2
was trying to help the situation and was trying to help everyone
calm down. Youth A reported Staff 2 did not do anything wrong
and did not hurt him in any way. Youth A reported he feels safe in
the home if Staff 1 is not there.
Youth B was interviewed in person at the facility on 2/2/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported he came
home sick from school on 1/26/23. Youth B stated Youth A came
in his room and accused Youth B of being a liar for coming home
sick. Staff 1 came in and told Youth A to leave Youth B’s room,
but instead of leaving, Youth A began saying bad words to Staff 1.
Staff 1 asked Youth A to leave again, but he still would not leave.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 asked Youth B to leave his room since Youth A
wouldn’t leave. Staff 1 said he was going to the store and asked
Youth B to come with him. Youth B reported on their way out of
the house, Staff 1 touched Youth A’s shoulder and told Youth A
next time he went into someone’s room without permission, Youth
A would lose $10. When Youth B and Staff 1 were close to the
door, Youth A told Staff 1 if he touched him again, there would be
consequences. Staff 1 turned his back and Youth A attacked him
by grabbing him around the neck from behind. Youth B reported
Staff 2 came to help separate them and Youth A became more
escalated. Youth B reported he did not see Staff 1 or Staff 2 do
anything inappropriate and did not see Staff 1 choke Youth A.
When Youth B and Staff 1 left the home, Youth B stated Staff 1
had tears in his eyes. Youth B reported Staff 1 is one of the best
staff at Casa Del Sol and he treated everyone well.
Youth C was interviewed in person at the facility on 2/2/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth C reported he was in
his room when the incident began. When he came out of his room,
3

Youth C saw Youth A with his arms around Staff 1’s neck and
Staff 2 was trying to separate them. When Staff 2 was trying to
separate them, Youth A said, “you want to fight me too?” and
began fighting with Staff 2. Youth C stated Staff 1 and Staff 2 both
told Youth A he could not hit them or anyone else, but he would
not listen. Youth C reported he did not see Staff 1 or Staff 2 do
anything inappropriate and did not see Staff 1 choke Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed in person at the facility on 2/2/23 in
conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he picked up
Youth B from school, brought him back to the house and told him
to go to his room since he was sick. Staff 2 was in the kitchen
when Youth A entered Youth B’s room and Staff 1 went in the
room to ask Youth A to leave. Staff 2 reported Youth A is known to
be a very mean child and escalates quickly. Youth A told Staff 1
he was not going to leave the room. Staff 2 then went to the room
to help and asked Youth B to come into the kitchen since Youth A
wouldn’t leave Youth B’s room. Staff 1 told Youth B to come with
him to the store. Youth A had left Youth B’s room and was sitting
in the living room. Staff 2 was still in the kitchen and did not see
how the altercation began. However, shortly after, he heard a loud
commotion, went to the living room, and saw Youth A’s arm
around Staff 1’s neck choking him. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was
completely defenseless, so Staff 2 tried to separate them by
getting in between them. Staff 2 reported he was trying to get
Youth A to go to his room because he was in an altered and
escalated state. Staff 2 reported Youth A would not go to his room
and instead punched Staff 2 in the abdomen and chest. Staff 2
reported he did not see Staff 1 grab Youth A by his neck or choke
him. Staff 2 stated if Staff 1 would have left the situation, Youth A
would have likely calmed down because Staff 1 was out of sight.
Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was not utilizing skills to de-escalate the
situation as Staff 1 was also escalated. Staff 2 reported Youth A
does not respect Staff 1 and frequently refers to Staff 1 as a “dirty
black man” or other racially offensive comments. Staff 2 reported
there was only one other situation in which Youth A has been
aggressive and he tried to throw a chair at Staff 2, but it hit the
wall instead.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 2/22/23. Staff 1 reported
when Youth B came home sick on 1/26/23, Youth A immediately
started picking on Youth B and telling Youth B he was faking
being sick, so he didn’t have to go to school. Youth B tried to go to
his room to get away from Youth A, but Youth A went into Youth
B’s room without permission. Staff 1 told Youth A he needed to
leave Youth B’s room multiple times, but Youth A refused verbally
4

and would not move. Staff 2 asked Youth B to leave the room
since Youth A wouldn’t, and then Staff 1 decided to take Youth B
to the store with him. When Staff 1 and Youth B were leaving the
home, they walked through the living room and Youth A was
sitting in a chair in front of the TV. Staff 1 reported he patted Youth
A's shoulder as he walked past and Youth A said, “come grab my
neck again”. Staff 1 reported he was shocked, so he came back
into the living room and said “I didn’t grab your neck. What are you
talking about?”. Staff 1 stated Youth A stood up, so Staff 1 turned
around to go back towards the door. When he turned around,
Youth A attacked him from behind and put his arm around Staff
1’s neck. Staff 1 reported he could have used self-defense but
chose not to. Staff 1 reported he was running out of breath from
being choked when Staff 2 came in the room to break them up.
Staff 1 admitted he was mad about Youth A trying to strangle him
and asked Youth A why he did it. Staff 1 reported he did not choke
Youth A but did push him up against the wall because Youth A
was escalated and trying to attack Staff 2. Staff 1 reported he did
not walk away or leave the situation because he was not going to
leave Staff 2 to fend for himself as they are taught to handle
situations as a team. Staff 1 reported he did not feel he was
treated fairly by the agency after the situation occurred as he feels
only youth’s lives matter in those situations, not employee’s lives.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Two separate videos of the incident on 1/26/23 were reviewed
multiple times throughout the investigation. One video is a camera
angle from the living room area and the other video is from the
overhead camera angle of the hallway that connects the living
room, kitchen, and bedrooms. The video shows Youth A sitting in
a chair in the living room in front of the TV. Staff 1 walks with
Youth B past Youth A and Staff 1 puts his hand on Youth A’s
shoulder, but it is not clear if it is a grab or a pat. Staff 1 and Youth
B walk out the front door and Youth A says something. Staff 1
walks back in the house past Youth B. Staff 1 walks over to Youth
A and they exchange words. Youth A stands up, Staff 1 turns to
walk away and Youth A attacks Staff 1 from behind. Youth A’s
arms/hands are initially around Staff 1’s shoulders, however,
Youth A then puts his left arm around Staff 1’s neck in a “choke
hold" position. Staff 2 then enters the living room and attempts to
verbally de-escalate Youth A, while trying to separate Youth A and
Staff 1. Staff 2 successfully releases Youth A’s arm from around
Staff 1’s neck and Staff 1 steps back. Staff 2 then pulls Youth A’s
right arm to pull Youth A further away from Staff 1. Staff 1 then
turns around and grabs Youth A's wrist. Staff 2 again uses verbal
de-escalation and separates Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 1 is near
5

the front door that is being held open by Youth B but does not
attempt to exit to remove himself from the situation. It should be
noted Youth A is not escalated at that time. While Staff 2 bends
down to pick something up, Staff 1 goes around behind Staff 2
and Staff 1 and Youth A begin pushing each other. Staff 2 stands
up and puts himself in the middle of them again to separate them.
Staff 1 then puts his left hand around Youth A’s neck, pushes him
backwards and holds him against the wall (all while Staff 2 is
attempting to separate them). They move off the wall into the
hallway and turn around while Staff 1’s hand remains around
Youth A’s neck and Staff 2 is attempting to separate them. Staff 2
finally separates them and uses his body to block Staff 1 in the
kitchen while Youth A remains in the hallway. Staff 1 and Youth A
continue to exchange words while Youth A pushes his body
against Staff 2’s body attempting to move him out of the way. Staff
1 turns around and Staff 2 and Youth A push each other using
their hands. Staff 1 then uses his hand to block Youth A’s
continued advances towards the kitchen to get to Staff 1. Staff 1
continues to stand in the kitchen, look at Youth A and exchange
words with him. Youth A continues to try and advance towards the
kitchen and Staff 2 uses his hands to grab both of Youth A’s wrists
separately. Staff 1 gets closer to Staff 2 and Youth A attempts to
advance towards him again. Staff 2 releases Youth A’s wrists and
uses his hands to push Youth A backwards (his hands remain in
contact with Youth A due to Youth A resisting). Staff 1 continues
to push Youth A, guiding him into the hallway, while Staff 1 walks
past towards the front door. Youth A attempts to push past Staff 2
to get to Staff 1 and Staff 2 stops Youth A by getting behind him
and wrapping his arm around Youth A’s shoulders. They continue
moving, and Staff 2’s right arm moves up towards Youth A’s neck,
which results in Staff 2 putting Youth A in a headlock position.
Youth A continues to fight and gets out of Staff 2’s hold. Youth A
then attempts to punch Staff 2 multiple times while Staff 2
attempts to block Youth A’s punches. Staff 2 is still attempting to
verbally de-escalate Youth A while this is occurring. Staff 1 exits
the house through the front door, but then comes back again.
Youth A stops trying to hit Staff 2 and they begin to talk. However,
as soon as Staff 1 steps into Youth A’s view, Youth A escalates
again and begins trying to hit Staff 1 and Staff 2. Staff 2 blocks
Youth A, but then grabs Youth A’s wrist and arm while pushing
him backwards down the hallway. Staff 1 continues to stand in
Youth A’s view and Youth A continues to try and advance towards
him by pushing and hitting Staff 2. Finally, Staff 1 leaves the
home, Youth A calms down, Youth A and Staff 2 talk and then
Youth A goes to his room.
6

DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Bethany Christian Services Incident report completed by
Supervisor dated 1/26/23 provides a summary of the
incident viewed on video and states Staff 1 placed his left
hand on Youth A’s neck and pushed Youth A backwards.
• MDHHS Incident report completed by Supervisor dated
1/30/23 provides a summary of the incident and states Staff
2 placed his arms around Youth A’s upper body/shoulders,
but as Youth A was moving, Staff 2’s arms were around
Youth A in a “headlock” position for 3 seconds. The report
notes Staff 2 quickly disengaged. The report notes Youth A
had a scratch on his neck, but Youth A could not identify
when or how he received the scratch because the
altercation was so quick.
• Bethany Christian Services Emergency Physical Restraint
Policy and Procedures dated 8/10/22 outlines approved
restraint methods per CPI Restraint Training, which staff
receive annually. It states staff are expected to adhere to
CPI guidelines in all interventions with residents. It also
notes staff are not allowed to restrain youth to fixed objects
such as walls.
• Bethany Christian Services Nurse’s Note states Youth A
denied any pain. He had a scratch on the right side of his
neck, but it was scabbed over already.
• Bethany Christian Services Performance Coaching Form
for Staff 1 dated 2/2/23 outlined Staff 1’s Termination of
Employment. One reason for termination was due to Staff
1’s Violation of the De-escalation policy.
• Staff 1’s employee training record notes he completed CPI
Top 10 De-Escalation tips on 9/28/22 and CPI training on
10/5/22. Staff 1 was suspended on 1/26/23 pending this
investigation and was ultimately terminated from
employment on 2/2/23. Staff 1 does not have any other
suspensions, disciplinary records, or write-ups in his
employee file.
• Staff 2’s employee training record notes he completed CPI
training on 12/14/22. Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary
records, suspensions, or write-ups in his employee file.
7

Analysis The facility is found in non-compliance as both Staff 1 and Staff 2
utilized unapproved restraint methods during their interactions with
Youth A.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
The agency must provide an incident report to MDHHS within 24
hours after any type of restraint, whether the restraint is an
approved method or not.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff member lacks the ability to perform job duties.
Investigation On February 2, 2023, Bethany Christian Services terminated Staff
1’s employment because of his actions towards Youth A during
the incident on 1/26/23.
On March 6, 2023, MDHHS Worker reported there was a
preponderance of evidence for physical abuse which resulted in a
confirmed case for Staff 1.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Bethany Christian Services Performance Coaching Form
for Staff 1 dated 2/2/23 outlined Staff 1’s Termination of
Employment. Human Resources substantiated Staff 1 for:
o Violation of the Employee Behavior Policy for
professionalism.
o Workplace misconduct due to physical violence or
intimidation, failing or neglecting essential duties,
client management rules or procedures or company
policies and failing or neglecting the welfare of
coworkers or other parties associated with the
company.
o Violation of the De-escalation policy.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 has a confirmed
case.
Conclusion Violation Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
